paragraph.paragraph: Accessible via the Debug/Overflow prevention... menu, this command makes it possible to detect stack overflows before they occur. Selecting it pops up a dialog that lets you decide at which call stack depth a warning should be issued.
By default a warning is issued when the debugged program reaches a stack depth of 1,000 elements.
paragraph.note: Note: Once an application has stopped at the selected level, it will not stop again until its stack depth goes below the critical stack depth again.
